definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: She puts a big bundle of dirty clothes on the counter.
sentences.chinese: 她把一大捆脏衣服扔到柜台上。

sentences.english: He egged her on  to throw a stone through the window.
sentences.chinese: 他怂恿她扔一块石头打破窗户。
他们无法想象向熊扔石头的做法。

sentences.english: Passersby, one by one, threw paper money and coins into the small bucket beside his feet.
sentences.chinese: 过路人纷纷向他脚下的一个小铁桶里扔着纸币和硬币。

sentences.english: If the conclusions can not be applied in practice, better dump them when it is still early.
sentences.chinese: 如果得出结论不能在实践中应用，趁早扔了。

sentences.english: How much wood would a woodchuck chuck.
At last the goatherd threw a stone, and breaking its horn.
sentences.chinese: 最后这个牧羊人扔了块石头打破了羊的角。

sentences.english: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.
sentences.chinese: 神把我扔在泥中，我就像尘土和炉灰一般。

sentences.english: Throwing shoes at somebody is a supreme insult in the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 在中东地区，向人扔鞋子是对人最严重的侮辱。

sentences.english: Selfish picnickers litter the beach with food wrappers.
sentences.chinese: 自私的野餐者乱扔包装纸使海滩杂乱不堪。

sentences.english: So we decided to throw the barracuda out.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们决定把那些梭鱼扔了。

sentences.english: The robbers hound her hand and foot and left her on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 强盗们捆住她的手脚，把她扔在地板上。

sentences.english: The billet fell as he spoke, and he threw it into a basket.
sentences.chinese: 他说着话，木柴掉了下来，他把它扔到篮子里。

sentences.english: Uncaught exception thrown by method called through Reflection.
sentences.chinese: 未捕获异常的方法称为通过反射扔。

sentences.english: Forget about level surfaces, forget about standing back, and just pick up your quadrotor and throw it.
sentences.chinese: 忘记水平面，忘记站在后面，就拿起你的旋翼扔。

sentences.english: The man threw leaflets for a write-in campaign for mayor before police pulled him up and arrested him.
sentences.chinese: 这名男子一直在朝下扔传单，为市长的竞选活动造势。

definition: to discard in the wrong place (cigarette butts etc)/to leave one's things lying around
conveniently/without extra trouble/while doing it/in passing
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to put down/to leave behind/to throw or knock down/to abandon or discard
to throw/to fling/to swing/to leave behind/to throw off/to dump (sb)
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
